title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was cool , last like 5mins Much things were not asked, tell me about your self. Answered about my work experienced and my current work. Why do you want to work here. Because I have the passion to work here.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: CERTIFIED TUMOR REGISTRAR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer ghosted me. She emailed me before the interview that she was having technical issues for the "telephone" interview and needed to reschedule to later that afternoon. I agreed to reschedule and she never contacted me. I sent her several follow up emails and she never responded back. This is more than unprofessional and disrespectful. It was a waste of time.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Met and interviewed with the hiring manager. received an offer a few months later. Only one interview. Their manager trusted them and did not need to interview me. Process was very smooth
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions applicable to the position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (San Antonio, TX) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: the interviewer was amazing he focused on my past experiences and I was hired!! never question about my age as well as my recent employment which is not related to nursing
Interview Questions: tell me about your experiences in your nursing career

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Fairly average questions interview with recruiter first then supervisor. The process was quick one week if they are interested will get back to you sometimes within the same week if the interview
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer, what was the outcome?

title: Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Most unprepared and negative interview I’ve had. The doctor interviewing came off extremely rude and belittling; it seemed like I was taking time up from her day. She didn’t really explain the role and rolled her eyes when I went over my qualifications. The manager seemed nice and wanted to schedule a second interview with other managers, but HR never reached out.
Interview Questions:
Are you going back to school? 
Will you be able to work full time with school?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The process began with the recruiter calling and setting up the actual interview time. At the interview it was pretty easy , it's just a matter of your comfort level in such a situation. It just so happened that my interviewer was very comfortable to speak with, which took away a lot of the anxiety and tension
Interview Questions: -How would you be an asset to the dept? -How would you handle a rude patient calling about a bill? -Are you ok with talking on the phones your entire shift (minus breaks)

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: They were quick to respond and very thorough. I had a phone call with a recruiter and then two in person interviews with hiring managers. They kept me updated through the entire process.
Interview Questions: They asked about my work history.

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and smooth. I was asked questions about my future goals and where I see myself in five years. They will also ask why you want to work there and address any concerns.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Video interview, easy questions takes them between 1-2 weeks depending on location to respond . Questions are Easy and the recruiters are nice. The interview is quick and they are 2 parts. One video and if they like the video then it’s a phone interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Prior experience, how long you’ve been in the field. Daily duties

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot of general behavior-based questions. The interviewers were polite and seemed interested in my experiences. Overall, I had a good experience and learned more about what it would be like working for University Hospitals.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult project?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: it was really nice and they were really helpful and i’m just typing this so that i can read what other people said, but overall i would assume they would use hire vue for interview now
Interview Questions: i had many questions lol

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was split into two parts: site visit & tour followed by a one-on-one interview with clinical site manager. Questions were pretty standard. Follow up involved speaking with HR.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you disagreed one of your colleagues. Describe the situation, how you handled the situation and the outcome.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: 1st you had a Phone Interview with HR Recruiter tgen if they felt you would be a good fit you were contacted for an  Interview with the manager of the department you also had to do an Online Interview asks questions you give response
Interview Questions: What your experience was in the field and how many years why you chose this field

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Met separately with 5 members of team. Interviews lasted 30 minutes each. Everything was done via Zoom. I was also asked to prepare a written assessment that took about 2 hours to prepare.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my interest in the position. I was asked about my background and what I was looking for in the position.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very lengthy. I had several interviews with HR, Directors, Medical Directors, and other Administrators. All interviews were over Zoom and ranged from 20 minutes to an hour depending on who I was meeting with.
Interview Questions: How do you prevent staff turn over?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Never heard back after interview even reached out multiple times. Via email and calls no one responded interview went well would been nice to know if I got the job or not
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard questions. Fast process and easy to navigate. They communicated well from the beginning to the rejection email. People are friendly and give you every chance to sell yourself.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflict? Strengths and weaknesses type stuff

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by recruiter to conduct a 15-20 minute phone interview. I then completed interview and then contacted by hiring manager to conduct a zoom interview . The zoom interview lasted 30 minutes in length.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work at University Hospitals

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interviewers. Straightforward questions. Took about an hour including a tour of the facility afterwards. Was overall impressed and pleased from start to finish. Seems like a great place to start and/or get your foot in the door in the medical field.
Interview Questions: Talk about a challenge you faced at work and how was it rewarding

title: Accounts Payable Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward phone interview. Position was new and the interviewer (later my supervisor) asked about my experience working in teams and my proficiency with Excel. Also asked about my ability to work in difficult situations.
Interview Questions: How proficient are you in using Microsoft Excel?

title: Revenue Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interviewed with recruiter. Second interview was with the managers. Both went really well. Everyone was very friendly and helpful--had a lot of info. They seemed genuinely interested in my thoughts and answers.
Interview Questions: Asked about my work history and skills.

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: After I filled out my application I was reached within 3 weeks then interview. Talked to department head and discussed availability. Also they do urine tests for drug and tobacco use.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Environmental Services

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Took about a couple of weeks.The UH recruiter seemed nice over the phone, questions were straightforward, about 30-40 mins long. They asked scenario-type questions. It was a pleasant interaction, small talk
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you disagreed with someone?  what are your strengths?

title: Clinical Reviewer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from HR to set up a video interview online.  Met with the recruiter over conference call. 
 She then set me up for an interview with the hiring manager as well as a departmental supervisor.  Everyone was very kind and very knowledgeable
Interview Questions: Goals, clinical experience, reporting experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was video recorded for the position applied to, there was no live person. It gave you time to breathe and think about answers before starting. Once started, you can pause between each question, but once you click next question, it counts down and you must be ready to answer because it will automatically start recording. The interview questions were broad and not pertaining to the specific position applied for. That part actually really threw me off.
Interview Questions: What was a memorable experience from your clinical rotation that left an impact on you and what was your part in the experience each step of the way?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: three interviews- first was a phone screen, spoke to a recruiter, then the two hiring managers, and then a couple recruiters on the team. i got the offer after 2 weeks of the interview process- quick and efficient
Interview Questions: What type of ATS do you use?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online, heard back within a week from a hiring manager. We spoke on the phone about my qualifications and she helped me set up another interview with other research assistants.
Interview Questions: Can you explain your research experience?

title: Research Institute Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Went through 3 rounds of interviews (recruiter phone screen, hiring manager, and the department ream). Everyone was extremely friendly and kind, however they strung me along for over 2 months with no communication and then sent me a rejection email. The entire time, the position was left open for accepting applications so I feel like they could've been more upfront and admitted they were pursuing other candidates rather than stringing along someone who is currently unemployed and thought they did well.
Interview Questions: Skills, background & experience, behavior-based questions with hypothetical scenarios.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview where you record yourself answering questions, then move on to phone interview with recruiter, then final phase of face to face interview with nurse manager on the floor
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why do you want to become a nurse, tell me about a situation and how you handled it

title: Lab Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Both Recruiters  and the department manager were very kind and professional. Due to the holidays there was a delay with the manager interview  also delay with  official offer from recruitment.
Interview Questions: All Questions asked where not about my skills but tell me a time and conflict handling also how I display  confidence

title: Picu Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was a peer interview for a PICU position. There were 2 charge nurses and 1 supervisor.  Many questions about support system, how you feel about infectious diseases etc. It lasted about 1 hour.
Interview Questions: How you handle stress in difficult situations

title: Patient Experience Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and very professional. I met with HR, the Hiring Manager, the Director of the Emergency Department, and someone currently in the role.  They all accompanied me on a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: Why does this position appeal to you?

title: Revenue Cycle Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about a month and a half. I applied mid summer and finally heard back from a recruiter at the end of August. She asked me some questions and pushed me to the next step, an interview with two hiring managers. I interviewed with the hiring managers a week later, and heard back from one manager to shadow for the position. I completed shadowing, and heard back a day later. They wanted to offer me the position. I received an official offer letter and accepted .
Interview Questions:
A lot of tell me about a time when questions. Very behavioral based, and they asked a lot of them, with some being somewhat similar in nature. 

Tell me about a time when you had to multitask, what did you do and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I applied and got a Email back for interviews a few days. Afterwards.The interview was a video with 9 questions. Interview was quick and easy to set up.Fairly easy interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want position in patient care

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews. Both very professional. Both on time. Parking was complimentary. Manager was very polite, professional and to the point. Seems to be a people person who cares about his staff.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a transporter?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Great experience and the interview was not bad at all. All in all very laid back and welcoming. I would apply for another job there but I have another job someplace else
Interview Questions: Why do you see yourself applying for this job?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. Then I received an email to do a Hirevue video interview after 3 days. Hirevue questions are not that hard, a lot of situational questions asking what would I do in X situation.
Still waiting for manager to contact me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your strength & weakness?

title: Senior Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview took less than 5 minutes. The job I applied for was remote, with travel once a quarter. So far so good. However they then stated that I would need to foot the bill for airfare and lodging during those times. I stated that those conditions are unacceptable, and they hung up.
Interview Questions: "Are you OK with paying for your own airfare and lodging?"

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy process, very direct. Took about 3 weeks for the whole process. I had 2 interviews, one with the recruiter and then the manager and the assistant manager on the unit. Both were about 30 minutes long.
Interview Questions: How would you be beneficial to the unit?

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with the recruiter and a few days later I had a zoom interview with the hiring manager. Process was smooth and very quick. Orientation was all online due to Covid.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience and what you can bring to the company?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: When interviewing for this position the staff pushed me through the whole process very quickly to the point that I was hired a week after my first interview.  I am very happy with how they handled this.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a patient?

title: Intensive Care Unit Nurse (ICU Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me about a HireVue Interview after just a few days of applying. Currently still in the interview process about a week later. I am hoping to receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at the specific hospital?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the unit manager, very laid back. Shadowed within the next week on the unit and stayed for 3 hours. Overall positive experience. Manager was really easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: What would your last boss say about you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional HR recruitment department. Set up and then cancelled several interviews with me at the last min. Seem unorganized from my perspective and these interactions made me seek employment elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Basic interview asking about work related experiences

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They talked about the job posting (what to expect) and asked basic questions.  Wage, on call, holidays and benefits were mentioned. They did most of the talking and asked 3-4 questions. Know the mission/values of the hospital.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked with a team to achieve a goal

title: Clinical Practice Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nice initial interview with entry-level HR professional.  Behavioral questions asked.  Reviewed each prior job and why I left.  Did not quite understand my circumstances and ownership positions which do not fit a typical profile.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your previous position?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward with behavioral questions with HR to more critical thinking and personal with hiring manager. The process took a couple weeks to complete. HR was very slow with the process and I felt like they were overwhelmed.
Interview Questions: Tell me why are left/wanting to leave your current employer?

title: Info Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Applied; Panel interview; Offer;  A wait of several weeks between area: application, panel interview and offer. The panel interview lasted about an hour. Everyone was very welcoming , received a tour of the working area and was given plenty of time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Strength and weakness; Tech questions; personality questions

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Basic 10 minute phone interview for a in person interview, the interview is scheduled after phone interview, either in person or zoom call,business casual dress code ,have copy of resume in person
Interview Questions: What qualities and experience do you have

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It took a while for them to contact me but when they did the process went smooth. I wish everyone the best apply for a role with them it’s such a great hospital !! Nice staff good place for you to grow your skill set.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Personal Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview and then another in person interview after that. They were very nice and professional. They are always considerate and kind. They only really want to hire good people
Interview Questions: They asked me about my work history

title: Triage Covid-19 Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Application, Phone Interview, Virtual Interview, 2nd Interview via phone and virtual. Offer, Filling out of the 11 step hiring procedure, including, Health accessment, drug test, TB test, Flu and Up to date vaccine records.
Interview Questions: Do you have any medical background that could help you in this position?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: i applied online, got an email from HR a week later, set up a phone interview w the recruiter which then set me up with the nurse manager. Two weeks later still waiting on a follow up
Interview Questions: why should i hire you

title: Grant Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I enjoy the interview process.It was very nice and friendly. The HR only ask basic questions like why am i applying for this role and what Excel skills do I have. And  they also went through my resume.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in UH?

title: Cash Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of several yes/no & behavioral questions. It lasted approximately 15-20 mins  via the telephone. The interviewer explained in detail about the position and the salary range.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed twice. The first was onsite, while the second was online. The whole exercise was a friendly one, and the admission process was well organized. I got the offer from overseas. It came with a J1 visa offer.
Interview Questions: Why I want to do a research Fellowship in UH

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview over the phone, was about 15 minutes long. The recruiter asked mostly simply yes/no questions, with a couple scenarios questions. Overall was pretty simple. Got a call back the same day for a face-to-face.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite part about Medical Assisting

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The process took 3 weeks from start to finish. I applied online. Couple of days later I was contacted by HR through email to schedule an Interview. We spoke for about 15 minutes, and she scheduled a f2f with the hiring manager for the following week. HR contacted me the following week for a follow up with the hiring manager. 
I received a call the same day after my second f2f from HR with an offer
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions. And also wanted to know more about my resume and the projects I did for some certifications on my resume.

title: Sales Associate/Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Someone calls to schedule an appointment, phone call takes 20 minutes. After, a in person interview is set in place. After that it takes a few days. You must get a background check and drug test. As a UH employee, you are not able to have any tobacco in your system.
Interview Questions: Past experience, what i want for my future, weaks and strengths

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Welcoming, very nice people and environment. The interview process was quick and organized. I had a phone interview with a recruiter first, and then I was set up with the managers
Interview Questions: Name a time you dealt with a difficult patient? How did you handle it?

title: Perioperative RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: -Phone interview conducted first with a recruiter...then an in person interview was set up with two nursing managers/education staff. I came back about a week later and Shadowed the OR before I was offered the position
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Nutrition Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Beachwood, OH) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was very easy and fast. Got contacted through email for a phone interview for the next business day. Phone interview went great so the recruiter scheduled a one-on-one interview right after. The interview was two days later. The day after the in person interview I got a call offering the position to me.
Interview Questions: What makes you drawn to a career in healthcare?

title: Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with morning shift Supervisor and Manager of our department. They went over my resume and asked me questions. Overall I felt comfortable talking with them both. It took them a couple of months to get me in the door. I did know within two weeks they really liked me and offered me a position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a nasty customer/doctor?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Do not waste your time. They cancelled the phone interview an hour before the scheduled appointment. The interview had been planned a week prior. Apparently the position had been filled before the interview process even started.
Interview Questions: "We have to cancel your interview at this time"

title: Orthopedic Extender Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Went over basic stuff like can you legally work in US and have you been convicted ect. Then couple questions about your previous position, then couple behavior questions.
Interview Questions: What did/do you like most about your previous job/what specialize in?

title: Schedule Coordinator/PAR/PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Westlake, OH) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, phone screen, and in person interview including being shadowed. To be honest if you don’t have tons of work experience relating to the job your apply for of if you aren’t referred, then you probably won’t get in and if you do it’ll be in a position you won’t want to stay in. I’ve had 3 interviews in the last 2 months and I still haven’t gotten in. I had 5 phone interviews and only 3 in person interviews and I’ve submitted 66 applications and half of them don’t require any experience at all like housekeeping for example. Some recruiters will contact you for a phone screen and you won’t hear anything back at all. You can call the talent acquisition dept to check the status of your app but all they will do is transfer you to the recruiter for that position.  It’s better to apply for CC because they are more likely to hire you without having experience or being referred.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UH?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Discovered the position at a job fair at my university,  took a business card and emailed manager with resume with follow-up message, on site interview a few days later, job offer a few days after the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you think your previous work experience would help you succeed in this position?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview. This was then followed by a phone interview. Both interviews lasted approximately 30 minutes.  Behavioral type questions were the main focus. Medium difficulty level.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Contacted by email after about 2 weeks to schedule a phone interview. After the phone interview, a phone interview was scheduled with the nurse manager of the unit for the following week. Had a follow up phone call with nurse manager a week later, where was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Scenario where you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Comfortable, and made me feel at ease. We did a walk around and went through the hiring process. Met some of the staff. Went over the training procedure.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was contacted by a recruiter for a phone screen interview. I then met with the manager to discuss the basics of the role. About a week later I had another interview to meet the team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Clinical Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Initially contacted via email by HR. Then preliminary phone interview with hiring manager, followed by in person interview. Then phone interview with peer/supervisor. Then told would have group interview with team. All this within one week. Felt sense of urgency in filling role(s) was conveyed by hiring manager at time of in person interview, as well as by peer interviewer.
Few days passed with no follow up by UH. Followed up by phone contact with hiring manager (I called). Requested next steps/if am still a candidate. 
Was told by hiring manager that they had pre scheduled interviews with other candidates to go through, so would be longer. 
I asked directly if I am one of candidates under consideration-again given same reply of have “so many other candidates with pre scheduled interviews, so have to give consideration to them as well". I then politely withdrew my candidacy, as I was not even given a time frame as to when the role(s) needed filled or straight answer. 
These hiring managers and HR staff need to realize in a tight labor market, experienced professionals with unique and in demand skill sets cannot wait around while they decide next steps. Overall disappointing, misleading, time wasting and frustrating experience. 
If you value your self respect and time, I strongly advise going with other organizations more deserving of your time and attention; particularly in this job market- it is truly in candidates favor.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: HR screens applicants and does preliminary phone interview. Department head then sets up interview - sometimes with other management personnel present.  Sometimes job postings and interviews are just a formality to make it look like they are seeking candidates when one has already been predetermined
Interview Questions: Name a problem you faced in your current position and how you solved it.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. The manager talked more than i did. Pretty got the job on the spot. Also listened to her personal family issues when i called to do a follow up on my interview. They were just very eager to fill a opening.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Doctor Secretary I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick there were two interviews one with a recruiter and then a second with the head of the department. The interview took no longer than 45minutes
Interview Questions: Where do you see your career going in the next 5 years

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Hudson, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a phone interview with basic behavioral interview questions. The second step was interviewing with Multiple Directors and took about 3.5 hours to complete. After meeting with the Directors I received an offer within 1 business day.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the Agile Methodology?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: very relaxed and not very informative.  Many key pieces were not disclosed during the initial process.  If I had been informed of what was expected of me and what I needed to do I do not think I would have moved forward with anything
Interview Questions: not much they talked more about themselves

title: Desktop Engineering Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview over the phone. Onsite Interview by Manager and Team Lead. It took a month from the time of the phone interview to the onsite interview. Standard questions about background and work experience. Discussed job role.
Interview Questions: Have I worked in HealthCare before?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone screen with a recruiter and a formal interview with the hiring manager a week later. The entire process from first contact to eventual offer took approximately 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were basic interview questions. The topics that I find to be most difficult include those which ask to describe a challenge or obstacle you've had to overcome in a previous position.

title: Health Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, contacted about a week later by a recruiter via email to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview was about a half hour and was very enjoyable and the recruiter was pleasant. Was informed I would hear something by the end of week or I should contact her. I was scheduled by the end of week for in-person interview with department manager in Cleveland on main campus. That interview was ok — was given tour around department, told what I would be doing, asked if I had any questions, etc. A week later I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UH

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I had to fly out on my own money, however, everything was very pleasant when I arrived. The questions were fair and the interviewers (3 to be exact) each wanted to make sure I was a good fit to the work environment.
Interview Questions: What was my interest in the Cleveland area

title: Clinical Fellow - Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, a recruiter called me around two weeks later to set up a phone interview. They set up an in-person interview with the rehab director at the facility, which happened about a week and a half after I talked to the recruiter. I got an offer a week later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you needed to work on a team.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone call was a little rushed about 10 minutes. Then 2+ weeks later I received a phone call for a face to face. Its scheduled for next week but I was rescheduled twice by call backs
Interview Questions: Have you moved to Ohio yet?

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: A phone call and then initial meeting with the manager was set up. Afterwards another meeting with the rest of the team members was required. The group meeting was only with a few other members of the team. They took turns asking questions, and allowed me to ask any questions I had as well.
Interview Questions: What qualifications from my past work experiences would benefit this position the most?

title: Human Resources Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University Hospitals in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview went very well.  Lasted over an hour.  I was then brought in for a 3 hour onsite interview.  The process began with a peer interview for an hour.  It was more of a big conversation with very unorganized questions being asked.  I then had an hour interview with two of the managers.  The managers seemed very exhausted and unenthusiastic during the process.  Seemed more like they were just going through the motions of the interview and not truly interested in me as a candidate or person.  I then shadowed an employee for a half hour, which was not very productive.  I felt that didn't need to be part of the interviewing process.  

I was told I would be contacted within the next few days for a second onsite interview.  I sent a thank you letter email.  Two weeks later, I still heard nothing from the HR team.  I called and left a voice message asking for an update.  They called back one week later (3 weeks total wait time, when I was originally told I would be contacted in 3 days).  I was told they have decided to move on with other candidates.  I was also told that I came off negatively during the interview process, then was further informed that I said certain phrases/ quotes that I NEVER said.  I was told they were concerned with my "professional personality".  Being a graduate, professional, and within this field for the past 10 years, I was more than shocked and insulted to receive such unprofessionalism from University Hospitals.  I've never had that type of feedback, I frequently have companies pursuing me and I'm the one turning them down.  

Overall-  Very unprofessional and immature interview process within the HR organization.  They did not follow up in a timely or respectful manner.  On top of that, insulted an educated and seasoned professional.  I truly feel I was the "Plus One" that they could legally claimed they interviewed, so they could hire who they already had in mind.  I was warned before I interviewed by many colleagues, that It's all who you know with University Hospitals.  If you're not good friends or relatives of someone wIthin the corporate side, or you're not considered a diverse candidate, good luck receiving an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The mananger refered me to this position. Meeting with an MD I will be working with, providing him with my expertise of the company, since he is new to our company
Interview Questions: About my work experience

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview last about 15 minutes,  Then if interested call set up face to face interview.  Nicotine testing, Flu shots required Background checks required  Great place to work I did my Externship at UH I loved it I still have one more Interview , praying I  get an offer
Interview Questions: What do you like most about being a Medical Assistant

title: Financial Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Shaker Heights, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Found this job on Glassdoor.  It immediately peaked my interest, and I decided to apply for it.  Received an email requesting a phone interview from an HR recruiter about 5 days later.  That was followed up by an in-person interview on March 20th, 2017 with the hiring manager as well as the hiring manager's direct boss.  The interview went well, and I walked away from it feeling both confident as well as a bit peculiar in regards to a statement made by both managers.  They stressed the need for expedience in getting a qualified candidate in as soon as possible, which left me with a hint of worry.

Fast forward almost two months to May 16th, 2017, when I received a phone call from the recruiter in which I was offered the position.  I explained to the recruiter that my current company was in the midst of planning for the coming fiscal year, and that my leaving in the middle of the planning process would create a massive responsibility vacuum.  In addition, I wanted to leave my current company on good terms, and leaving amid the craziness of the planning process would definitely be considered a burnt bridge.  Finally, my current company incentivizes employees to stay through the planning process by offering a bonus to everyone who is on the payroll when the process wraps up.

Due to the aforementioned reasons, I requested a July 2017 start date.  This was absolutely negotiable, and I assumed the recruiter would need to get this approved.  The recruiter indeed stated they would need to check with the managers, and get back to me.  Three days later, my July start date was approved, and I received an official offer letter with the desired start date, salary, etc. which I accepted.

A little over a week later, I received an email from the recruiter stating that my start date would need to be revisited, and to get in contact with them as soon as possible.  I responded and asked what had changed to necessitate moving up the start date, as it had previously been approved.  I received no response for over a week, during which I placed several phone calls and emails only to come up empty.  The recruiter finally responded via email roughly 10 days later, only to reiterate the same "we need to revisit your start date" line without providing any justification for doing so.  I again responded promptly, asking why.  Once again, I received zero responses for over a week.

The recruiter finally phoned me on Monday June 5th, 2017 and gave me a company-desired start date of June 19th.  I contacted the recruiter the next day (June 6th), and reminded them from our previous conversations that starting any sooner than when I requested would put my current company in a bad position.  I would also lose out on a significant amount of money for leaving a mere 11 days early.  The recruiter stated they'd need to once again speak with the managers to see what could be done, and if they could compensate me for the lost bonus money.  Once again, I did not hear from the recruiter for a week.

Last Tuesday (June 13th), the hiring manager's boss phoned me to see what was going on.  I explained that I received an official letter with the July start date, and that I was never given a reason as to why the recruiter was pushing for a different one.  The individual then began to get irritated, and questioned my communication style as well as heavily insinuated that what I was doing was unprofessional.  The individual accused me of withholding information from the initial interview back in March, which was absolutely and truly false.  I was nothing but forthcoming as to why I requested the start date I did.  The conversation devolved from there, and culminated in me declining the offer based on the lack of communication from the recruiter, the attempts to change an official start date without providing justification, and the accusatory tone the hiring manager's boss took with me before I even started the job.

In hindsight, I should have contacted the hiring manager and their boss directly once the line of communication between the recruiter and myself broke down.  Alas, I did not, as I incorrectly assumed the recruiter knew how to do their job.  Furthermore, I did not want to throw this recruiter under the proverbial bus before I even started the job, and I had an official offer letter with my desired start date to go off of.  I truly feel this is an isolated incident attributable to the recruiter not getting proper authorization for my requested start date, then attempting to right the ship by bringing me onboard sooner.  Finally, calling a future employee's communication skills, professionalism, and credibility into question before they even start the job is the absolute worst way to start off a professional relationship.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for University Hospitals?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process went really well. The managers were really polite and relaxed - which helped me relax and be able to answer their questions better. Even though they decided to pursue other candidates, they were really polite about not choosing me for the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a conflict you had in the workplace?

title: Clinical Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was interviewed for pediatric hematology oncology fellowship position. It was one day visit interview. I met 5 attendings. They were in different styles.  You met program director first, then 2-3 attendings. Then you asked your questions to the fellows. Then the associate director.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: received email from recruiter, had a phone interview  that went well. the interviewing manager told me she thought I would be a good fit and I was told I would hear from the hiring manager for the 2nd interview. A month later...Never heard back.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when you had to deal with an irate customer

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I meet with the administrative assistant and the Head of the department I applied for, ask some questions and I ask my own question, explained about their department. Asked me about myself and what I could bring to the table.
Interview Questions: Are we allowed to excel within the department?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: First applied online, then was contacted by "talent acquisition" to schedule a phone interview. After phone interview we scheduled an in person interview with the nurse manager on the floor. After the interview with the NM and ANM I shadowed an RN on the unit for an hour. After the shadow experience I was offered the job on the spot and accepted.
Interview Questions: What does "relationship-based care" mean to you?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and shortly got a call back from a recruiter. I was scheduled for a phone interview for a few days later. After my phone interview, I was called for a one on one interview. They called all my references and proceeded with a background check. I checked my status online quite often. I was then offered the job about a week later.
Interview Questions:
Typical interview questions. 
Why do you want to work for UH? 
Tell me a time when.. 
What would you do if ...
How would you handle ...

title: Junior Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview screening process was great, via PC and phone. No webcam. It was a good learning experience since this was my second technical interview after college graduation. They ask a lot web dev questions, which aren't taught in school, you have to learn it yourself. Never used ajax in my life, but i expect you need to know that to get the job. The feedback was positive, but they said they needed someone a little bit senior-ish. I was hoping they were open to me learning in the job.
Interview Questions: Fizzbuzz code

title: Social Worker II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: My initial contact with University Hospitals (UH) was by email; after I submitted my application and resume online for a full-time Social Worker II position.  The email sent by UH stated that they'd like to conduct an interview and asked that I call the provided phone number to set up a phone interview.  After being interviewed by telephone,  I was invited to come in for a face to face interview,  to  meet with the Supervisor of the department.  After the interview,  I was told that recommendations would be forwarded to Human Resources and I will recieve feedback. With 2 days,  I was contacted by the UH representative who conducted the telephone interview and was informed that UH wanted to move forward after the "post interview" and would be checking my references.  The representative stated that they'd be in contact with 1 week or less. However,  over 1 month passed.  Eventually I was contacted by the same UH representative and offered a PRN position!
Interview Questions: Describe one of your most successful moments in my current job.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was called and scheduled for a phone interview 2 weeks later. Three days later I had a in person interview. Received an offer 2 weeks later. I interviewed with a panel of managers of various departments. It was intimidating but not hard to get through.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position online. I was contacted by a recruiter who asked behavioral based interview questions. I was referred to the hiring manager who also asked behavioral based interview questions. Throughout the process, the recruiter keeps you informed and your status online reflects where you are in the process.
Interview Questions: Name a time when...Give an example of.

title: Secretary/Pca Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions:
(1) Recruiter interview
(2) Manager interview 
(3) Shadow interview

Everyone was professional and friendly throughout the entire hiring process. Interviewing went as expected, although the process does take a while. Overall good experience!
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral interview questions

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (North Olmsted, OH) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized and moved quickly. I met with the nurse manager, asst nurse manager, and nurse educator for a group interview and was offered the position the same day. I went to HR and got my badge and turned in my tax and ID docs, went to employee health and had a drug and TB screening, and started my orientation within a week of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Anesthesia Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Typical scenario questions.  The manager was running late and seemed to be somewhat disorganized when bringing others into the interview to ask additional questions.  Manager was friendly, but could have been better with structuring the time management regarding the interview.
Interview Questions: What was a time when you had a difficult patient and family, and how did you deal with that?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and didn't hear anything or see a status change for two and a half months. Post-application, there is a personality test. After two months, HR contacted me. There was not a phone screening. The actual interview process was brief. HR set up an in-person interview with the department head. We spent minimal time discussing the job and its duties. It wasn't a typical professional interview. Much of our time was spent touring the facility. I don't feel the interview prepared me for the role, though I did come prepared with questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about insurance?

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Rotating interviews with multiple members of project team.  Very professional, standard situational interview questions pre-prepared.  Same questions asked by each member of the project team. One interview was panel style, not sure if this was because of time constraints etc.  Human Resources process was very long but this was likely attributed to the high volume of hires needed for the project and is not likely normal process.
Interview Questions: Standard situational interview questions

title: Primary Care Institute Medical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two step involving the human resources director. I never got a chance to speed to someone that could understand my skill set. It was very surprising since I was very qualified and had a great reputation with the hospital
Interview Questions: Scenario based

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick contact from recruiter after applying. Quick and flexible to schedule on site interview. Everyone was friendly and helpful. A little difficult to navigate the campus. Very large. Finding employee health is difficult
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 5 years. How well do you work in a team. What is your most proud accomplishment. Why do you want to leave current job. Why University hospitals?

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: phone interview then in person with like 12 groups. All day process. took me 2 days since people were missing They do not cover parking, go early because of traffic and just finding where to go.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two managers interviewed me at the same time. The interview took about 45 minutes. This was followed by a tour of the hospital and meeting and speaking to current employees. The total time spent was 2 hours. My parking was compensated.
Interview Questions: What does the motto "To heal, To teach, To discover" mean to you? How will you apply it to this job?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I had a phone interview which didn't last long. Then I had one face to face interview with a supervisor at the Main Campus for a position at the satellite office. The interview went great and she was really nice. The interview lasted less than thirty minutes and within a week, I was called and offered the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation

title: IRB Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process. One over the phone with HR and one in person meeting with three different individuals. Interview on the phone was fairly short and HR individuals seemed to lack knowledge on the specific areas of the job. The interview with the actual staff members was more difficult but still asked rather obvious questions.
Interview Questions: Difficulties interacting with other individuals.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The response time with HR was timely and professional. First step was a phone interview with the recruiter/hiring staff. I then went through an in person interview with the manager that I would be working under. It was a professional and strong interview experience.
Interview Questions: How did your previous experience prepare you for this position?

title: CNS Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was lengthy but fair. Had opportunity to meet several members of the team and the physicians. Open to questions and feedback. Process was very tedious though and took very long. There were several opportunities to discuss the job specifics and ask questions about the position. The managers were open to new ideas.
Interview Questions: Experiences with patient care.

title: Change Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was polite and easy to speak with.  I was asked specific, but common interview questions.  At beginning of interview I was told the structure of the how the interview would go and there was room for questions at the end
Interview Questions: How do you handle when you feel overwhelmed at work?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview with a recruiter foing over bhavioral based questions.  Then onto hiring manager interview within 1 week.  Was able to meet with team members as well.
Interview Questions: How do you motivate people

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: They are very efficient (so don't waste their time!)  I was brought into the lab directors office; there were 4 people there to interview me.  They have a number of the standard questions they ask that appear to be somewhat tailored to the individual and what additional information that need. They are very interested in how you will deal with difficult co-workers and how you will hold-up in a stressful work environment. (They described the core lab as akin to a factory floor..)
Interview Questions: What was the most stressful thing about your clinical rotation?

title: Cornea Image Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I worked here before, and was hired internally. Therefore there wasn't much of an interview procedure besides the skills testing, which consisted of learning about the technology and how to analyze the data.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Patience Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going first the recruiter contracts you then you get a face to face interview. After that it's a waiting game because everything is done through the recruiter.  A background check is ran before you get a call with an offer. That's when they discuss hours and pay rate with you
Interview Questions: Describe a time when...

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met the Director and Manager. They wanted to give me a summary of expectations and how many patients i'd see in a day, or per hour. They asked if I had questions. They told me how contracts were made to be an employee.
Interview Questions: How much was my salary?

title: Andrologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Beachwood, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted via phone by a recruiter in the HR department to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview lasted about 30 to 45 minutes and was basic questions about my background and experience as well as personality questions. At the end of the phone interview the recruiter set up an in person interview with the head of the department before ending the phone conversation.
     For my in person interview I met with the other employees working in the lab while waiting to meet with the doctor. During this time I was able to ask them a few questions and they also looked over my resume. I then sat down with the head doctor of the IVF lab and he asked me the same basic interview questions that I had for the phone interview. I was there for a total of about 45 minutes. 
     About a week later I was contacted by the HR recruiter again to set up a second interview as well as start a background check and have my references contacted. For the second interview I met with the head doctor again and he asked me basically the same questions he asked the first time. I also met with one of the department managers and he asked about availability and the commute time to and from the hospital for me. I was then given a tour of the lab by a few of the current andrologists and embryologists. After the tour I met with each of the employees individually and I was able to ask them some questions and they also asked me some questions. This part of the interview was a bit awkward because it was obvious none of the employees knew exactly what to say or ask of me. It seemed like they were unaware that they would have to sit down one on one with me. This whole interview process took a total of about an hour and a half. I was told I would hear back from them either way within a week.
    During the next week all three of my references were contacted. Throughout the entire interview process I was able to go online to the careers website and check the current status of this process. At this time the status said background check in progress. I still hadn't heard anything a week later so I called the HR recruiter and left a message with her asking about the status of the position. After several days I still had heard nothing so I called her once again and left another message asking her to get back to me. I never ended up hearing anything back from the company at all. The status on the website continued to say background check in progress until 2 months later when it finally was updated to not selected for position. I found it extremely frustrating and unprofessional to have never heard anything back even though I contacted them twice to ask about it and I was told I would hear either way.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Beachwood, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to state pros and cons of my character. I was mostly question with certain types of scenarios and how I responded to each of them based of relevant clinical experiences.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to work with a difficult co-worker or manager and how did you respond?

title: Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview was simple.  Over the phone with a HR rep.  Behavior based questions that are related to position.  HR rep did not go into major detail about the position.  Some of the information will have to be answered by the hiring manager.  I was able to ask my own questions at the end of interview.  Could not get a direct salary amount.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work well with a team

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Concord, Lake, OH) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was laid back, yet professional and they made me  feel very comfortable and welcome. Management was fantastic through the entire interviewing process. They kept me informed throughout the entire interviewing process. I would highly recommend employment with UH. I enjoy my job and patient care is very rewarding.
Interview Questions: What can you offer UH

title: Clinical Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Beachwood, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I was initally contacted by HR who conducted a brief phone interview on the spot. After that, she arranged for an in-person interview with the hiring manager who made me an offer on the spot.  This was for the Rehabilitation hospital in Beachwood.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was an external candidate and the overall process took about 3 months. I applied for the position in May 2014, received a call about it in June 2014. I had to go through a phone interview with a recruiter. From there I had a group interview with the manager and two supervisors of Radiology in July. After that, I had to wait for a background check to clear and I was offered the position in July upon passing a drug test. I began working in mid-August.
Interview Questions: There weren't really any hard questions.

title: Coding Specialist II - Hospital-816721 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Shaker Heights, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, initial phone interview was great went smoothly; since internal application. The process is straight forward and to the point didn't have any concerns with first phone interview. The second interview was swift but with a couple of statements saying an employee can not have a part time position and a full time position at the same time in two different departments.
Interview Questions: Second telephone interview did not went so well first she was 5 mins late. She stated that I could not work two non-exempt positions which is untrue. At the end HR  stated that it went well and scheduled a face to face we discussed a date& time but then said she'll get back to me for confirmation. Checked my status now they say I'm not selected. Poor communication

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with HR. Second interview with department supervisors.
Interview Questions: Hypothetical situation questions set up to lead you to give personal information.

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Computerized application process.  Computer tends to screen out qualified individuals.  Process can take over 30 days from application status to HR generalist interview, then on to department interview and hire.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of the best improvement you made at a previous facility and explain the impact it had on the department or facility.

title: Training and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: A total of 3 interviews, first one with staff/recruiting manager, next one with manager of trainers and the last one was with team members.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral questions, lots of what would you do questions, scenarios, etc.

title: IT Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The process was long.
Interview Questions: thoeritical questions and code test

title: Medical Assistant/Parma Hospital Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Parma, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two ladies interviewed me. They looked over my resume and asked me questions based off my previous work history. "Tell me about  a time when.." "How did you handle that situation?" "Why did you choose medical assisting?" "Tell me about yourself?"
Interview Questions: An unexpected question that I was not prepared for was "What department would you most be interested in?"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Initial Communications: The website was fairly easy to use for the application, however, I could not get the job agent to work, so if a job was posted for less than 24 hours, sometimes I missed an opportunity to apply. 

Planning: When I was being considered for a position, a recruiter called me and scheduled an interview. Again, everything went quite smoothly with this, and she was very pleasant on the phone.

Number of interviews: There were 3 interviews. One over the phone with a nurse recruiter, which went very well. This interview was mostly questions about whether or not I was even truly eligible to work there (i.e. have you ever been charged with a felony) and then a few behavioral questions. Then, there were 2 in-person interviews with the nurse manager and the manager's assistant. These interviews also went incredibly well. I felt very confident that I had a shot at the position. This is when things went south. After all of the smooth communications, I heard nothing after the interview for 3 weeks and then got an email saying this, "Although we appreciate your interest, we would like to inform you that we've decided to pursue other candidates for this position." I got no feedback at all as to what had caused them to wait 3 weeks to tell me this and was just strung along all that time thinking I might have had a shot. I even called and asked if they could give me feedback, so maybe I wouldn't make the same mistakes again or something, but they refused, saying it was company policy to not do so (understandably I guess, but still incredibly frustrating). 

Perception: I felt that Rainbow did a great job with the interview process right up until the end there. The phone interview was great and the in-person manager and assistant interview were also very smooth and comfortable. I just don't understand why they needed to string me along for 3 weeks just to email me and say I didn't get the position. I can't imagine they were interviewing other candidates for 3 weeks after me, but maybe they were. It just would have been nice to know that I didn't get the position sooner, because I would have pushed harder looking for other positions during that period of time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a plan and the situation changed causing you to need to rework you plan and how it affected your patient.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: very thorough, comfortable, and encouraging
Interview Questions: Why did I go into Pharmacy

title: Dietary Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easy manager is young and laid back makes you fill comfortable, she checked her phone throughout the interview, and while asking me questions she read from a paper and wrote my answers to the questions. The recruiter will contact previous and current employers to ask about you. Then, a background check will take place.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you had to handle an angry customer and what was the outcome.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very monotone, not pleasant at all
Interview Questions: none of the questions were difficult

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Elyria, OH) in Aug 2013
