Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, one on one, polite interviewer, I felt comfortable answering all questions, human resources paperwork was organized and self explanatory. I was able to tour the faculty that day, and meet and interview other staff members, explained all salaries and benefit options. Ask questions without interruption and provide feedback during the interview process
Interview Questions: Explain job qualifications, examples of care and interactions with patients, personality traits, career goals, past job experiences, and future goals

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Process involved interviewing with 7 different individuals including 3 at once. Interview questions were pretty basic with some behavioral questions asked as well. Interview process from screening to offer was about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you resolved an issue and the steps you took to resolve it?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: First an interview with human resources, then a more in depth interview with management in the department. The questions were the typical how would you react questions. The HR interview was about 15 minutes. The interview with the dept was about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult patient or customer?

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Beachwood, OH) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: First I was called by a recruiter for a phone screening. Then she scheduled me for a face-to-face interview with the Operations manager. Process took about 3 days.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected. What's has been your best & worst team experience? What's the most effective management style you have ever worked under? How have you dealt with a difficule co-worker in the past?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Very timely, process did not take long from start to finish, beginning with application review, interview to hiring. Supervisor was very warm and welcoming, eased any nerves.
Interview Questions: Typical interview, nothing you wouldn't expect or out of the ordinary.

title: Centralized Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with HR recruiter and was a scheduled for a face to face with the hiring supervisor
Interview Questions: All of the Questions were standard questions that are asked at all interviews

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: online application, phone interview, in person interview
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Warrensville Heights, OH) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I have never seen a Staffing Department so organized.  From the phone screen to the interviews it went smooth & quick.   They stayed in touch with you through the process and everyone was so nice.  They have their process automated and you get quick feedback.
Interview Questions: I did not come across any difficult or unexpected questions.

title: EVS Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening with the HR generalist.  Two days later I had a face to face interview with the head of the department.  We discussed the specifics of the position, including hours, salary and expectations.  The following Monday I started my first day at Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital.
Interview Questions: Give me a time when you had a negative client with a bad impression of the hospital? What did you do to change their perception?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone screen. I was then contacted for a face-to-face interview with HR and the Hiring Department. I received a formal offer within a week of my face-to-face interview. I accepted. The process was relatively quick and easy. The interview was a group interview and was very informative of what to expect as a member of the team.
Interview Questions: Why UH

title: Senior IT Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was already there as a contract employee, but it still took almost four weeks to be on-boarded.  A few new hires in my orientation class took more than two months to complete the process.
Interview Questions: How would my individual contributions be different than the previous employee.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: First interview with an HR recruiter. Was invited to meet with hiring manager within 2 weeks of first interviews. After interview with hiring manager, I was invited to meet with the major stakeholders and co-workers. Overall, it was well organized and moved along fairly well. Unfortunately, they chose an internal candidate to fill the position.
Interview Questions: This position interfaces with the board of directors and major donors. How comfortable are you with communicating with this audience?

title: Allied Healthcare Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was late, Not very friendly, Asked the same question 3 different ways throughout the process, very long
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a negative interaction with a fellow co worker.

title: Recruitment Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Shaker Heights, Cuyahoga, OH) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process for an external candidate can be very lengthy. You have to complete a behavioral based interview with a recruiter over the phone prior to receiving a face-to-face interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: None of the questions are difficult, you just need to be able to give a full STAR: Situation/Task, Action and Result. This requires you to be as specific as possible, pulling from various situations in your career/work history.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University Hospitals in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply Online, Phone call from Recruiter to set up over the phone interview, or will perform a short over the phone interview on the spot, if moved on to next interview it will be with mgmt. After mgmt interview, you can wait 2 wks to 4 months for approval, depending on hiring mgr.
Interview Questions: Standard Behavioral Questions

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the office on the website, and received a reply later in the day. I went in to the office and was shown around and asked general behavioral questions and what my schedule would be like. I was offered the position later the next day.
Interview Questions: Are you available every weekday?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews one on the phone two in person.  The one interview was with the lab direter the other in person interview was with 8 technical coordinators.  It went very well.  I felt at ease and their personalities were wonderful.
Interview Questions: Wat are your downfalls?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Shaker Heights, Cuyahoga, OH) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: The in-house recruiter was really unorganized - didn't contact me when she said, didn't have any information for me when I contacted her.  The first interview with the hiring manager was very good - he focused on the interview and asked relevant questions.  The second round was with a series of managers who all were unprepared and acted as if the interview was a bother.  Each interview started late and ended early.  The interviewers were rushed and more focused on getting to that next meeting than in learning about my background.
Interview Questions: They had the bias about a nonhealthcare background and 'asked' several times if I really understood how difficult it is to be in their environment, as the resources are so tight.

title: Senior Genetics Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview, then I was invited for a few hour interview on site, 1 to 1 with Lab manager, with the center director, and with the lab supervisor. After that I had an interview with group members. I can not say that the process was difficult. Some questions were related to my professional background, but nothing too specific, or that I would not know about. There were too many questions or remarks that were aimed to reveal whether I was planning to be on the job permanently, there was some tension about it. Overall, it was interesting. I had many opportunities to ask about job duties. I can just give advice to everyone to ask questions about your future job. It is not only the job selects us, we should select the job that will fulfill our expectations and give a chance to open our potential.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Financial Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: In person interview was conducted by newly appointed director. She was late for the interview for a meeting, was interupted during the interview by a phone call and we never really was able to finish since she had a meeting scheduled immediately following the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on dealing with the learning curve in this position?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University Hospitals (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy
Interview Questions: Explain challenges of working as a team
